result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel A Pineda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges to apply for work.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12-19-2014 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: No contact with Sianna T. (dob:  9/21/1998) without approval of the court, Desiree T. and mutual desire.
Court waived supervision fees, but shall pay 1 DNA surcharge and all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges based on inability to pay.
Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Anger Management. Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending review hearing on 12-19-14.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel A Pineda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges to apply for work; credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending review hearing.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Anger Management.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with Sianna T. (dob:  9/21/1998) without approval of the court, Desiree T. and mutual desire.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court waived supervision fees, but shall pay 1 DNA surcharge and all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges based on inability to pay.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 23.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12-19-2014 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Nicholas Zacherl. On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) , a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Eduardo M Borda.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea Hearing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
CORRECTION: Scheduling Conference reflects corrected date of 6/2/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Eduardo M Borda.  Michael Thurston for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez. Defense counsel requested case be set adjourned Scheduling. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

JUDGE WAGNER FOR BRANCH 23, JUDGE GRADY.
Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Eduardo M Borda.  Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel WAIVED Spanish Interpreter for this hearing, Attorney Borda is fluent in Spanish. Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for Pretrial Conference, CD included in discovery from the state was defective. State to provide Defense with new CD. Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Victim's mother present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order to remove Sherry P. from order.   Court modified order to remove Sherry P.

Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Abbey Marie DeSiato for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

14RM016015  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
 03-21-14

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.T. (9/21/1998), SHERRY P., OR DESERAE T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.

Defendant Manuel A Pineda in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Manuel A Pineda in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge DALLET.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge GRADY, Br. 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
